001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
004import org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput;
005import org.bitcoinj.script.ScriptBuilder;
006
007import java.util.Collections;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Simple implementation of SigningRequest
012 */
013public class DefaultSigningRequest implements SigningRequest {
014    private final List<TransactionInputData> inputs;
015    private final List<TransactionOutputData> outputs;
016
017    public DefaultSigningRequest(List<TransactionInputData> inputs, List<TransactionOutputData> outputs) {
018        this.inputs = Collections.unmodifiableList(inputs);
019        this.outputs = Collections.unmodifiableList(outputs);
020    }
021
022    @Override
023    public List<TransactionInputData> inputs() {
024        return inputs;
025    }
026
027    @Override
028    public List<TransactionOutputData> outputs() {
029        return outputs;
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * bitcoinj signing uses (currently) mutable transaction objects, this
034     * convenience method will create one if you want to use bitcoinj to sign this request.
035     * @return an unsigned bitcoinj transaction
036     */
037    public Transaction toUnsignedTransaction() {
038        Transaction utx = new Transaction();
039        this.inputs().forEach(in ->
040                utx.addInput(in.toOutPoint().hash(),
041                        in.toOutPoint().index(),
042                        ScriptBuilder.createEmpty()));
043        this.outputs().forEach(out ->
044                utx.addOutput(new TransactionOutput(utx,
045                        out.amount(),
046                        out.scriptPubKey().program())));
047        return utx;
048    }
049}
